tit.e: Jizo-bon (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children)
Jizo-bon (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children)
Jizo-bon (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children)
tit.cmt: タイトルのためカッコ内の補足削除→次文に説明あり→新規ルールにより括弧内説明を補足

sen.j: 地蔵盆（じぞうぼん）は、地蔵菩薩の縁日（毎月24日）であり、尚かつお盆の期間中でもある旧暦7月24日に向け、その前日の宵縁日を中心とした3日間の期間を指し、またそのうちの日を選んで行われる地蔵菩薩の祭のことをいう。
sen.e: Jizo-bon means the day when fair of Jizo Bosatsu (Jizo Bodhisattva) (24th of each month) is on, or the period of three days before the evening fair towards July 24 of old calender in Obon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Soul's Day), or it also means the day of the festival of Jizo Bosatsu which the day is chosen one of those days during festival.

Jizo-bon is the day of the festival of Jizo Bosatsu (24th of each month), or the period of three days before the evening festival on July 24 of the old calender in the Obon festival, or it also means the day of the festival of Jizo Bosatsu, which is chosen from the days of the festival.
sen.cmt: this needed a lot of work
sen.e: Jizo-bon is the day of the festival of Jizo Bosatsu (24th of each month), or the period of three days before the evening festival on July 24 of the old calender in the Obon festival, or it also means the day of the festival of Jizo Bosatsu, which is chosen from the days of the festival.

sen.j: ただし、地蔵盆は一般には寺院の中に祀られている地蔵菩薩を対象とした祭りではない。
sen.e: By the way Jizo-bon is not the festival generally represent Jizo Badhisattva which is enshrined in the temples.
By the way, Jizo-bon does not generally celebrate Jizo Bodhisattva enshrined in temples.
By the way, Jizo-bon does not generally celebrate Jizo Bodhisattva enshrined in temples.

sen.j: 道祖神信仰と結びついた路傍あるいは街角（辻）の地蔵が対象となっているのである。
sen.e: It represent Jizo seen in waysides or street corner, and Jizo is related to the belief of Doso-shin (traveler's guardian deity).
It represents Jizo seen on waysides or street corners, and Jizo is related to the belief of Doso-shin (traveler's guardian deity).
It represents Jizo seen on waysides or street corners, and Jizo is related to the belief of Doso-shin (traveler's guardian deity).

sen.j: 旧暦7月24日以外の地蔵菩薩の縁日の24日は、地蔵会（じぞうえ）、地蔵祭と呼ばれるが、旧暦7月24日については盂蘭盆（お盆）期間中であり、それにちなんで地蔵盆と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: On the 24th when the fair is on, except the day of 24 July on the old calendar, is called Jizo-e (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children) or Jizo-bon, however, in terms of the day of 24 July in old calendar, since it is during Urabon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Soul's Day, around the 15th of July or August, depending on local customs), it is called Jizo-bon.

On the 24th when the fair is on, except the day of 24 July in the old calendar, is called Jizo-e (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children) or Jizo-bon, however, in terms of the day of 24 July in the old calendar, since it is during Urabon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Soul's Day, around the 15th of July or August, depending on local customs), it is called Jizo-bon.

On the 24th when the fair is on, except July 24 in the old calendar, is called Jizo-e (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children) or Jizo-bon, however, in terms of July 24 in the old calendar, since it is during Urabon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Soul's Day, around the 15th of July or August, depending on local customs), it is called Jizo-bon.
sen.cmt: the day of 24 July→July 24としました。

sen.j: 現代では、参加する人々の仕事などに合わせ、多少日程をずらして土日に行うところも増えている。
sen.e: Currently in some areas the day of the fair is changed to Saturday or Sunday to suit people's needs who work on weekdays, so that they can come to the fair.
Currently in some areas the day of the fair is changed to Saturday or Sunday to suit people's needs who work on weekdays, so that they can come to the fair.
Currently in some areas the day of the fair is changed to Saturday or Sunday to suit people's needs who work on weekdays, so that they can come to the fair.

sen.j: なお、地蔵盆が新暦の7月24日前後もしくは8月24日前後に分かれるのは、お盆を新暦に改めて勤めるのか、それとも旧暦風に8月に行うのかの差異であり、この差異についてはお盆の項を参考にされたい。
sen.e: By the way the reason why Jizo-bon separate into before or after 24 July or 24 August in New calendar (solar calendar), is because there is a difference between when to have Obon festival (a Festival of the Dead or Buddhist All Soul's Day), either change the date to new calendar, or to have it in August in the old calendar, please refer to next chapter in the details of the difference when to have Obon.

By the way, the reason why Jizo-bon separate into before or after 24 July or 24 August in the solar calendar, is because there is a difference between when Obon is held, either changed to the new calendar, or held in August of the old calendar - please refer to next chapter for details of differences in when Obon is held.

By the way, the reason why Jizo-bon separate into before or after July 24 or August 24 in the solar calendar, is because there is a difference between when Obon is held, either changed to the new calendar, or held in August of the old calendar - please refer to next chapter for details of differences in when Obon is held.

sen.j: 地蔵盆は全国的に行われている風習であるが、滋賀県、京都府、大阪府など近畿地方において特に盛んである。
sen.e: Jizo-bon is custom cerebrated in all over Japan, it is especially popular in Kinki region such as Shiga Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture.
Jizo-bon is a custom celebrated in all over Japan, it is especially popular in the Kinki region, such as Shiga, Kyoto and Osaka Prefectures.
Jizo-bon is a custom celebrated in all over Japan, it is especially popular in the Kinki region, such as Shiga, Kyoto and Osaka Prefectures.

sen.j: 地蔵祭では、地蔵のある町内の人々はこの日にかけて地蔵の像を洗い清めて新しい前垂れを着せ、化粧をするなどして飾り付けて、地蔵の前に集って灯籠を立てたり供物をしたりして祀る。
sen.e: On Jizo Matsuri, people in the town where they have Jizo statue around the area, wash the body to purify especially on this day and put new apron, or put make up on the face to decorate, and enshrine by giving some food or gather around the Jizo and put lantern around.

On Jizo Matsuri, people in towns where there are Jizo statues wash them to purify especially on this day, and put new aprons on them, or put makeup on the faces to decorate, and worship by giving some food or gather around the Jizo and put lanterns around them.

On Jizo Matsuri, people in towns where there are Jizo statues wash them to purify especially on this day, and put new aprons on them, or put makeup on the faces to decorate, and worship by giving some food or gather around the Jizo and put lanterns around them.

sen.j: 地蔵盆の前後には、地蔵の据えられる家や祠の周囲などに、地蔵盆独特の提灯が多く飾られる。
sen.e: Before and after Jizo-bon, chochin (Japanese paper lantern) especially used for Jizo-bon are often seen in the area where Jizo is enshrined around the house or hokora (a small shrine).
Before and after Jizo-bon, special paper lanterns used for Jizo-bon are often seen in the area where Jizo are enshrined around houses or small shrines.
Before and after Jizo-bon, special paper lanterns used for Jizo-bon are often seen in the area where Jizo are enshrined around houses or small shrines.

sen.j: 京都では子供が生まれると、その子の名前を書いた提灯を奉納する風習がある。
sen.e: In Kyoto there is a tradition to dedicate a votive sutra of chochin with the name of the baby when new baby is born.
In Kyoto there is a tradition to dedicate a votive sutra of chochin with the name of the baby when new baby is born.
In Kyoto there is a tradition to dedicate a votive sutra of chochin with the name of the baby when new baby is born.

sen.j: おおむね女子は赤、男子は白で、その子が地蔵盆に参加しているあいだは、毎年飾られる。
sen.e: Most of the time the color of chochin is red for girls, white for boys, and it is put on as decoration while that baby participate in Jizo-bon.
Most of the time the color of chochin is red for girls, white for boys, and it is put on as decoration while that baby participates in Jizo-bon.
Most of the time the color of chochin is red for girls, white for boys, and it is put on as decoration while that baby participates in Jizo-bon.

sen.j: 地蔵菩薩は中近世以降子供の守り神として信仰されるようになった。
sen.e: Jizo Bosatsu became to be believed as guide god of children after medieval period.
Jizo Bosatsu became to be revered as guardian of children after the medieval period.
Jizo Bosatsu became to be revered as guardian of children after the medieval period.

sen.j: ひろく知られた伝説によれば、地蔵菩薩が、親より先になくなった子供が三途川で苦しんでいるのを救うという。
sen.e: There is well known legend that Jizo Bosatsu save children at Sanzu-no-kawa (the River of Three Crossings) who died before their parents and suffer.
There is well known legend that Jizo Bosatsu saves children who died before their parents and suffered at Sanzu-no-kawa (the River of Three Crossings).
There is well known legend that Jizo Bosatsu saves children who died before their parents and suffered at Sanzu no kawa (the River of Three Crossings).

sen.j: このことから地蔵祭においては特に子供が地蔵の前に詣り、その加護を祈る習わしになっている。
sen.e: Due to above, it is custom for especially children sit in front of Jizo to pray and to receive divine Grace in Jizo Matsuri.
Because of this, it is customary for children to sit in front of Jizo to pray and to receive divine Grace in Jizo Matsuri.
Because of this, it is customary for children to sit in front of Jizo to pray and to receive divine Grace in Jizo Matsuri.

sen.j: ところによっては、仏教による読経や法話も行われることがあるが、おおむねそれらの多くの子供達に向けたものである。
sen.e: There is dokyo (sutra chanting) or Buddhist sermon of Buddhism held in different places, but they are held for children most of the times.
There is sutra chanting or Buddhist sermons held in different places, but they are held for children most of the time.
sen.cmt: repetition; unnecessary use of Japanese terms and parenthetical explanations
sen.e: There is sutra chanting or Buddhist sermons held in different places, but they are held for children most of the time.

sen.j: 地域によっては、地蔵盆当日の朝に「数珠回し」がおこなわれる。
sen.e: In some areas, 'Juzumawashi' is held in the morning of the day of Jizo-bon.
In some areas, 'Juzumawashi' is held in the morning of the day of Jizo-bon.
In some areas, 'Juzumawashi' is held in the morning of the day of Jizo-bon.

sen.j: これは、町内の子供が、直径2～3メートルの大きな数珠をかこんですわり、僧侶の読経にあわせて順々にまわすというものである。
sen.e: This is children in the town sit around the big beadroll of 2 to 3 meter long, and they move the beadroll as the monk read dokyo.
This is children in the town sitting around a big bead roll of 2 to 3 meters long, and they move the bead roll as the monk reads dokyo.
This is children in the town sitting around a big bead roll of two to three meters long, and they move the bead roll as the monk reads a sutra.
sen.cmt: reads dokyo→reads a sutraとし、数字をスペルアウト

sen.j: 今日では地蔵盆は子供のための祭とも言え、地蔵に詣った子供達は地蔵の前に集まった席で供養の菓子や手料理などを振る舞われる場合が多い。
sen.e: Nowadays Jizo-bon can mean festival for the children, after they pray for Jizo they were given some sweets or home made foods prepared for service for dead people in the area where children gathered around Jizo.

Nowadays Jizo-bon can mean a festival for children, after they pray for Jizo they were given some sweets or home made foods prepared for service for dead people in the area where children gathered around Jizo.

Nowadays Jizo-bon can mean a festival for children, after they pray for Jizo they were given some sweets or home made foods prepared for service for dead people in the area where children gathered around Jizo.

sen.j: また地域の子供達が一堂に会するため、子供達に向けたイベントも行われたり、そのまま子供達の遊び場となることもしばしばである。
sen.e: Also some events for children are organized since many children gather in the local area all at once, often the place change into children's play area after Jizo-bon festival.
Also some events for children are organized since many children gather in the local area all at once, often the place changes into a children's play area after Jizo-bon festival.
Also some events for children are organized since many children gather in the local area all at once, often the place changes into a children's play area after Jizo-bon festival.

sen.j: 初日朝に地蔵盆の用意をし、仏僧による読経、子供におやつの配布（日に一度か二度）、夜のイベント（踊りや線香花火など）。
sen.e: In the morning on the first day of the festival, Jizo-bon is prepared, there will be dokyo by monk, distribution of sweets to the children (once or twice a day), events at night time (dancing or senko hanabi (a type of Japanese fireworks) are organized.

In the morning on the first day of the festival, Jizo-bon is prepared, there will be dokyo by monks, distribution of sweets to children (once or twice a day), and events at night time (dancing or fireworks) are organized.

In the morning on the first day of the festival, Jizo-bon is prepared, there will be sutra recitation by monks, distribution of sweets to children (once or twice a day), and events at night time (dancing or fireworks) are organized.

sen.j: 翌日、おやつ配布、お供えのお下がり配布、後片付けといった流れが多いようである。
sen.e: In many places sweets and other food for an offering will be distributed and things are put away on the following day.
In many places sweets and other food for an offering will be distributed and things are put away on the following day.
In many places sweets and other food for an offering will be distributed and things are put away on the following day.

sen.j: しかし、子供が少なくなったことや大人たちの都合がつきにくくなったりすることから、一日で終えてしまう町内も増えつつある。
sen.e: However in some towns the festival is finished in one day due to the decrease of the number of the children or people could not come due to other commitment.
However, in some towns the festival is finished in one day due to the increasing number of children or people who cannot come because of other commitments.
However, in some towns the festival is finished in one day due to the decreasing number of children or people who cannot come because of other commitments.
sen.cmt: 原文には「少なくなった」とあるため、increasing→decreasingに修正

sen.j: また、地蔵盆における福引は、「ふごおろし」とも呼ばれる形式で行われていた。
sen.e: There is a lottery in Jizo-bon, which was drew in 'Fugooroshi' style.
There is a lottery during Jizo-bon, which was drawn in 'Fugooroshi' style.
There is a lottery during Jizo-bon, which was drawn in 'Fugooroshi' style.

sen.j: 福引担当の家の向かいの家から渡したロープにつるし紐で手繰り寄せた。
sen.e: The rope was put thought to a house across the house of person in charge of lottery and the prizes were gathered by pulling hanging rope.
A rope was hung between the house of person in charge of lottery and the house across the street, and prizes were gathered by pulling hanging cords.
sen.cmt: this needed a lot of work – I'm not sure what the translator thinks “thought” meant in this context
sen.e: A rope was hung between the house of person in charge of lottery and the house across the street, and prizes were gathered by pulling hanging cords.

sen.j: その後、その品を紐で1階へ下ろして渡すものである。
sen.e: After that the prize was put down to downstairs.
After that the prize was brought downstairs.
After that the prize was brought downstairs.

sen.j: しかし、最近ではこういった福引はほとんど見られなくなった。
sen.e: However this style of lottery is not often seen nowadays.
However this style of lottery is not often seen nowadays.
However this style of lottery is not often seen nowadays.

sen.j: また、町内によっては大日如来が祭られており、それらの町内では大日如来の縁日である旧暦7月28日もしくは、それ前後(地蔵盆同様、お勤めする時期に7月もしくは8月の差異あり。）に、同様の祭り・大日盆を行う。
sen.e: Sometimes Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana) is enshrined in some towns, and in these towns the same festivals or Dainichi-bon is cerebrated on either 28 July in old calendar which is fair of Dainichi Nyorai, or on before or after this date (similar to Jizo-bon, either July or August is recommended.)

Sometimes Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana) is enshrined in some towns, and in these towns the same festivals or Dainichi-bon are celebrated on either 28 July in the old calendar, which is the festival of Dainichi Nyorai, or on, before or after this date (similar to Jizo-bon, either July or August is recommended).

Sometimes Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana) is enshrined in some towns, and in these towns the same festivals or Dainichi-bon are celebrated on either July 28 in the old calendar, which is the festival of Dainichi Nyorai, or on, before or after this date (similar to Jizo-bon, either July or August is recommended).

sen.j: 上述の地蔵盆と同じく日程をずらして土日にすることが多いため、年によっては他の町内に1週間おくれて大日盆を勤めることもある。
sen.e: Often the festival is held on different date on Saturday or Sunday, similar to Jizo-bon, some towns have Dainichi-bon festival one week later than others, depend on the calendar of each year.
Often the festival is held on a different date, on Saturday or Sunday, similar to Jizo-bon, some towns have Dainichi-bon festival one week later than others, depending on the calendar of each year.
Often the festival is held on a different date, on Saturday or Sunday, similar to Jizo-bon, some towns have Dainichi-bon festival one week later than others, depending on the calendar of each year.
